column1: Narre Warren is a suburb of Melbourne
column3: 38 km southeast of Melbourne's central business district in the local government area of the City of Casey. At the 2016 Census
column4: Narre Warren had a population of 26
column5: 621. Narre Warren has a population density of over 2000 people per square kilometre. Narre Warren has its own railway station
column7: and is home to Australia's second largest shopping centre (by Gross Leasable Area)
column9: after Chadstone Shopping Centre. The biggest secondary school in Narre Warren is Fountain Gate Secondary College.

column1: The most common ancestries in Narre Warren were Australian 21.9%
62.7% of people were born in Australia. The most common foreign countries of birth were India 3.6%
The most common responses for religion were Catholic 28.8%
66.7% of people spoke only English at home. Other languages spoken at home included Dari 10%
Over the years Narre Warren has grown from a semi-rural residential town to become a part of a major growth corridor in the southeast of Melbourne.
In recent years a multitude of new housing developments have seen Narre Warren expand to such an extent that it now adjoins neighbouring suburbs such as Berwick.
Schools in Narre Warren include Narre Warren North Primary School
column9: Dandenong Valley Special School and Fleetwood Primary School (formerly known as Hallam Valley Primary School)
column10: Narre Warren South P-12 College and Waverley Christian College - Narre Warren South Campus. Narre Warren Station Primary School was closed at the end of 2001 and moved to Narre Warren South (to suit the change in growth areas) where it became Hillsmeade Primary School.  There is also a large community education centre

column1: Westfield Fountain Gate (named after one of the earlier subdivisions) is at the heart of the main commercial precinct in Narre Warren. It is one of the largest shopping centres in Australia
column2: housing many of Australia's major retailers. The centre has been made famous by the popular Australian television show Kath & Kim
column3: parts of which were also filmed at Westfield Southland.There is also a local shopping strip around the railway station in Webb Street.

column1: The civic precinct is located outside the boundary of Westfield
column2: and includes the City of Casey municipal offices
column3: Narre Warren Library and the Casey ARC (Aquatic and Recreation Centre). This precinct has recently finished a $300 million redevelopment by the Casey Council
column4: an entertainment precinct by the name of Bunjil Place.
